com.storytron.uber

Class OperatorUsageGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storytron.uber.OperatorUsageGraph

  • public final class OperatorUsageGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for analyzing usage relations among custom operators.

      Constructor and Description
      OperatorUsageGraph()

      void add(CustomOperator op)
      Adds a custom operator so its usage relations can be analyzed.

      Adds a usage relation between to operators (i.e.
      void addUsers(CustomOperator used, java.util.Set<CustomOperator> users)
      Clears a given set and adds to it all the operators that used directly or indirectly a given operator.

      Tells if the usage graph has any cycle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OperatorUsageGraph

        public OperatorUsageGraph()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(CustomOperator op)
        Adds a custom operator so its usage relations can be analyzed.

      • remove

        public void remove(CustomOperator op)
        Removes a custom operator from the graph.

      • addUse

        public void addUse(CustomOperator used,
                   CustomOperator user)
        Adds a usage relation between to operators (i.e. an edge on the graph).

      • removeUse

        public void removeUse(CustomOperator used,
                      CustomOperator user)
        Removes usage relation between to operators (i.e. an edge on the graph).

      • getPath

        public java.util.List<CustomOperator> getPath(CustomOperator used,
                                              CustomOperator user)
        Gets the path that describes how execution of user implies execution of used. Returns an empty list if execution of user does not imply execution of used.

      • addUsers

        public void addUsers(CustomOperator used,
                     java.util.Set<CustomOperator> users)
        Clears a given set and adds to it all the operators that used directly or indirectly a given operator.

      • getCycle

        public java.util.List<CustomOperator> getCycle()
        Tells if the usage graph has any cycle. If there is no cycle an empty list is returned.
